attributes.action: Install lights and cameras by the Winter Garden car parking spaces.
attributes.additional_details:
Thanet Council have repeatedly ignored the needs of the public along where hospital workers, members of the public, police officers, tourists and dog walkers park. Along this strip is vital parking as Margate is already hugely struggling with parking. 
Recently, damage to vehicles, thefts from vehicles and drug dealing has increased in the area as there are no lights and no cameras in the area to deter would-be offenders. 
People work all day, to return to damaged vehicles and missing items.
attributes.background:
The Winter Garden rear parking area is vital for the public and employees around Margate. 
We are calling on Thanet District Council to install lights and cameras to try and deter offenders who have been targeting parked cars down there without risk of being caught, and causing serious damage.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. We cannot accept petitions about matters that are a decision for local authorities.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.thanet.gov.uk/info-pages/petition-the-council/
